body: The string `phpunit_mockobject_autoload` does not exist in any repository related to PHPUnit anymore. I cannot reproduce this.

That was the first error.  I've updated my copy, but now I'm getting the following error:

PHP Fatal error:  Call to undefined function file_iterator_autoload() in /Library/WebServer/Documents/lifereach/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Util/GlobalState.php on line 379
PHP Stack trace:
PHP   1. {main}() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/bin/phpunit:0
PHP   2. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/bin/phpunit:46
PHP   3. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php:130
PHP   4. PHPUnit_TextUI_TestRunner->doRun() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php:192
PHP   5. PHPUnit_Framework_TestSuite->run() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/TextUI/TestRunner.php:325
PHP   6. PHPUnit_Framework_TestSuite->runTest() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Framework/TestSuite.php:745
PHP   7. PHPUnit_Framework_TestCase->run() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Framework/TestSuite.php:772
PHP   8. PHPUnit_Framework_TestResult->run() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Framework/TestCase.php:751
PHP   9. PHPUnit_Framework_TestResult->addError() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Framework/TestResult.php:695
PHP  10. PHPUnit_Util_Log_JUnit->addError() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Framework/TestResult.php:260
PHP  11. PHPUnit_Util_Filter::getFilteredStacktrace() /Library/WebServer/Documents/projectvendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Util/Log/JUnit.php:177
PHP  12. PHPUnit_Util_GlobalState::phpunitFiles() /Library/WebServer/Documents/project/vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit/PHPUnit/Util/Filter.php:70

(Note: I'm not calling these methods directly.  The test that fails is very simple.  In fact, the test should fail due to an invalid array index, if that's of any help.)

I have no idea how you are updating your copy. None of the `*_autoload()` functions are called directly any more. The string `vendor/pear-pear.phpunit.de` in your error message leads me to believe that you are not using the official Composer repository to install PHPUnit.

This is happening to me as well, after an attempt to upgrade 3.6.12 using pear only.  Unfortunately, upgrading PHP to < 5.3.2 is not an option at this time. 

PHP Fatal error:  Call to undefined function file_iterator_autoload() in /usr/share/pear/PHPUnit/Util/GlobalState.php on line 379

phpunit --version
PHPUnit 3.6.12 by Sebastian Bergmann.

pear list

# Installed packages, channel pear.php.net:

Package           Version State
Archive_Tar       1.3.10  stable
Config            1.10.12 stable
Console_Getopt    1.3.1   stable

Structures_Graph  1.0.4   stable
XML_Util          1.2.1   stable

Any suggestions other than upgrading to support Composer?

Sorry for the delay.  I upgraded to v3.7 and my issue(s) have been resolved.  I still recommend looking into the changes made about a week ago, because that's when things started going wrong for no apparent reason.

The `package.xml` in the `3.6` branch now has the metadata information on the maximum version supported for each dependency. PHPUnit 3.6.12 was re-released using that metadata.

I had the same problem reported at the beginning of this thread, and it was solved by removing lastest version of phpunit/PHPUnit_MockObject and installing phpunit/PHPUnit_MockObject-1.1.1 in the pear packages.

Same problem here, but was an APC cache issue.

php -dapc.enable_cli=1  -r "apc_clear_cache();"

Hi,
I also have the "Call to undefined function phpunit_mockobject_autoload()" problem. On development machine, it's not a problem: my testUnits run fine. Running them under Jenkins (or on the cmd-line of the same machine) gives me the error. I do not run XDebug on development machine, I have XDebug on Jenkin's machine. Maybe this help.

This is a copy of the stack when I have the error. The error disappears if I skip the database testing.
1. {main}() /usr/bin/phpunit:0
2. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command::main() /usr/bin/phpunit:44
3. PHPUnit_TextUI_Command->run() /usr/local/zend/share/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php:125
4. PHPUnit_TextUI_TestRunner->doRun() /usr/local/zend/share/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/Command.php:187
5. PHPUnit_TextUI_ResultPrinter->printResult() /usr/local/zend/share/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/TestRunner.php:331
6. PHPUnit_TextUI_ResultPrinter->printErrors() /usr/local/zend/share/pear/PHPUnit/TextUI/ResultPrinter.php:156

11. PHPUnit_Util_GlobalState::phpunitFiles() /usr/local/zend/share/pear/PHPUnit/Util/Filter.php:70
upgraded to 3.7.8 on Jenkin's machine, solved the problem.

Got the same error that @texdc mentioned (undefined function file_iterator_autoload) with the following "pear list":

```
Package          Version State
Archive_Tar      1.3.7   stable
Console_Getopt   1.2.3   stable
PEAR             1.9.4   stable
PHPUnit          1.3.2   stable
Structures_Graph 1.0.4   stable
XML_RPC          1.5.4   stable
XML_Util         1.2.1   stable
```

Ran a "pear upgrade", which bumped:

```
Archive_Tar      1.3.7 => 1.3.10
Console_getopt   1.2.3 => 1.3.1
XML_RPC          1.5.4 => 1.5.5
```

And it works now. Not sure if one of the packages was at fault, or something just needed to be reset within Pear.
how to upgraded 3.7.8 on Jenkin's machine in fedora 17

I faced similar errors, but upgrading php was not an option. I successfully got PHPUnit 3.6 working with PHP 5.3.2. After lots of installs/uninstalls I figured out that you need to downgrade the dependencies by 1 minor version. Pear will install latest versions for all dependencies which do not work. Details are here http://blog.ashwinidhekane.com/installing-phpunit-with-php-5-3-2/
I solved the problem by downgrading PHPUnit_MockObject from 1.2.3 to 1.1.0, I guess this is because the function phpunit_mockobject_autoload is no longer available in PHPUnit_MockObject 1.2.x

pear was prevented from upgrading if `PHP_Invoker` was installed on a windows system as it's new version requires [PCNTL extension](http://www.php.net/manual/en/pcntl.installation.php) not available on windows.

```
>pear uninstall phpunit/PHP_Invoker
phpunit/PHP_Invoker (version >= 1.0.0) can be optionally used by installed package "phpunit/PHPUnit"
uninstall ok: channel://pear.phpunit.de/PHP_Invoker-1.0.1
```

Upgrade then went well:

```
>pear upgrade
Did not download optional dependencies: phpunit/PHP_Invoker, use --alldeps to download automatically
phpunit/PHPUnit can optionally use package "phpunit/PHP_Invoker" (version >= 1.1.0)
downloading DbUnit-1.2.2.tgz ...
Starting to download DbUnit-1.2.2.tgz (41,888 bytes)
............done: 41,888 bytes
downloading PHPUnit-3.7.13.tgz ...
Starting to download PHPUnit-3.7.13.tgz (117,403 bytes)
...done: 117,403 bytes
downloading PHPUnit_Selenium-1.2.12.tgz ...
Starting to download PHPUnit_Selenium-1.2.12.tgz (40,358 bytes)
...done: 40,358 bytes
upgrade ok: channel://pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit-3.7.13
upgrade ok: channel://pear.phpunit.de/DbUnit-1.2.2
upgrade ok: channel://pear.phpunit.de/PHPUnit_Selenium-1.2.12
```

I know pear is not really cool but as my system had it I was lazy to switch. PEAR even is too dumb to recognize that the optinal PHP_Invoker doesn't work on my platform.

Earlier the upgrade failed:

```
phpunit/PHP_Invoker requires PHP extension "pcntl"
phpunit/PHPUnit requires package "phpunit/PHP_Invoker" (version >= 1.1.0), installed version is 1.0.1
phpunit/DbUnit requires package "phpunit/PHPUnit" (version >= 3.7.0), installed version is 3.6.7
phpunit/PHPUnit_Selenium requires package "phpunit/PHPUnit" (version >= 3.7.0), installed version is 3.6.7
No valid packages found
upgrade failed
```

[ref](http://chat.stackoverflow.com/transcript/message/7630333#7630333)
@bluejoo This is not a PHPUnit-related issue. Your code uses the [`Ctype`](http://php.net/manual/en/book.ctype.php) extension, but you don't have it installed/enabled.
